intro: Amphilophis, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family. It is characterized by its unique, often intricate floral structures and specialized adaptations for pollination. These plants typically grow in rocky or crevice habitats, showcasing their ability to thrive in challenging environments. The flowers often display a range of colors, including shades of pink, purple, and white, which attract specific pollinators. Due to their habitat preferences, Amphilophis species are often found in temperate and subtropical regions.
